medical_history.chief_complaint: Fetal growth restriction and cystic structures in the fetal brain detected during routine mid-trimester ultrasound.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Initial symptoms noted at 24+1 gestational weeks during a routine ultrasound, revealing fetal growth restriction and cystic structures. Follow-up ultrasound at 28+1 weeks showed persistent and enlarged cystic structures with progressive microcephaly and further reduced growth velocity.
medical_history.social_history: Both the patient and her husband were usually in good health, with no bad habits such as smoking and drinking.
